alert.note: Alert for Bedford (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 8:23PM CST until February 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace affecting Bedford County. For Wartrace Creek...including Wartrace...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Wartrace Creek Near Wartrace. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water begins to inundate Winette Ayers Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 9.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is forecast to continue rising this evening then begin falling overnight. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 600 AM CST.
